title: Just Eat is just a question of appetite for Naspers
text:
For proof that there is no such thing as karma, look no further than Naspers, the parent company of Just Eat’s latest bidder Prosus.

Throughout most of the 20th century, as a South African newspaper publisher, Naspers dedicated itself to the cause of Afrikaner nationalism. It supported in print and even helped to fund the National Party and the racist regime it built. Following the fall of apartheid in the 1990s, Naspers declined to cooperate with the Truth and Reconciliation Commission that sought to heal some of the wounds left behind.

Naspers received no karmic punishment for such moral bankruptcy, however. Instead, the universe rewarded it with one of the most fortunate and lucrative bets...
description: For proof that there is no such thing as karma, look no further than Naspers, the parent company of Just Eat’s latest bidder Prosus.
